com.pokerface.pokerapi.game

Class HandRanking

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pokerface.pokerapi.game.HandRanking
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<HandRanking>

    public class HandRanking
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<HandRanking>
    HandRanking is used to evaluate hands by the GameService at a hands end to see who won, this ranking is then used by the pot to evaluate who gets what winnings. HandRanking is also used to evaluate AI position for move decision, it will consider what hand it has and then modify its actions based on that.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  HandRanking.Type
      Type is all of the types of hands in a game of poker

      The rank is the type of hand that this hand is scored as.
      private java.util.List<Card> tieBreakers
      the tieBreakers are a list of cards occurring in the order that they should be used to determine who won in the event of a tie.

      • findStraight

        private java.util.List<Card> findStraight(java.util.List<Card> cards)
        findStraight takes in a sorted list of cards, and returns a straight if it finds one.
        Parameters:
        cards - a sorted list of cards
        Returns:
        a straight in sorted order, or null

      • findSets

        private java.util.List<org.springframework.data.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,Card>> findSets(java.util.List<Card> cards)
        findSets finds all repeated card ranks in a list, and returns a sorted list of which the ranks, along with the number of times it appears.
        Parameters:
        cards - a sorted list of cards
        Returns:
        a list of pairs containing a count of how many times the given rank appears and a card that is a member of the set. if no pairs exist, the list will be empty

      • findFlush

        private java.util.List<Card> findFlush(java.util.List<Card> cards)
        findFlush tests to see if the given cards contain a flush.
        Parameters:
        cards - the list of cards to test
        Returns:
        if a flush exists, return all cards that are a member of that suit. if a flush doesn't exist, returns null.

      • highCardNotRank

        private Card highCardNotRank(java.util.List<Card> cards,
                             Card.Rank... not)
        highCardNotRank takes in a sorted list of cards, and returns the highest card within that list that does not have the same rank as another card in the not list.
        Parameters:
        cards - the list of cards to use
        not - the list of ranks to ignore when looking through cards
        Returns:
        the highest card in cards that does not have a rank in not

      • filterOutRank

        private java.util.List<Card> filterOutRank(java.util.List<Card> cards,
                                           Card.Rank... filter)
        filterOutRank takes in a list of cards, and returns a copy of the list without the ranks in filter
        Parameters:
        cards - the list of cards to filter
        filter - the list of ranks to filter out of cards
        Returns:
        the cards list without any cards that have a rank in filter

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(HandRanking otherHand)
        compareTo checks to see whether this hand is ranked above, below, or is tied with another hand. 1 if this hand wins against otherHand, 0 if this hand is tied with otherHand, and -1 if this hand looses to otherHand.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<HandRanking>
        Parameters:
        otherHand - the HandRanking to compare this hand to
        Returns:
        whether or not this hand wins, ties, or looses to otherHand

      • getHandType

        public HandRanking.Type getHandType()
        get the hand type of this hand (pair, two pair, flush, etc.)
        Returns:
        the type of hand

      • pairComparator

        private static java.util.Comparator<org.springframework.data.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,Card>> pairComparator()
        return a comparator that will be able to sort sets. of cards. this comparator will rank sets with more cards over sets with less (ie, three of a kind over pair) and will sort sets of equal size by rank (ie. a pair of aces over a pair of jacks)
        Returns:
        the set comparator
